column1: UNICEF, WHO, World Bank Group Joint Malnutrition Estimates, May 2022 Edition.               Stunting numbers affected (millions) 2000-2020.

Stunting refers to a child who is too short for his or her age. Stunting is the failure to grow both physically and cognitively and is the result of chronic or recurrent malnutrition. The devastating effects of stunting can last a lifetime.
Stunting (moderate and severe): percentage of children aged 0–59 months who are below minus two standard deviations from median height-for-age of the WHO Child Growth Standards.
Oceania excluding Australia and New Zealand
Oceania excluding Australia and New Zealand
1. Consecutive low population coverage; interpret with caution.

2. The estimates for the year 2020 do not account for the full impact of COVID-19.  Household survey data on child height, weight and age were not collected in 2020 due to physical distancing policies. One of the covariates used in the country model takes the impact of COVID-19 partially into account.
3. World Bank Income Classification is based on FY 2022 Classification
